channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Woman smashes TV stand during living room dance routine
item.description: Comical footage, captured in Irvine, California, U.S., shows the anonymous homeowner accidentally break her TV stand while performing a dance routine in her living room.

item.title: 'Daddy changed the world': George Floyd's six-year-old daughter Gianna says she misses him
item.description: The six-year-old and her mother Roxie Washington appeared on Good Morning America on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Rivers carry 43m tonnes of carbon from fires to sea every year
item.description: Carbon tumbles into rivers as ash and charcoal after fires, or is dissolved into them. Scientists made the find after measuring the amount of carbon flowing through 78 rivers in tthe world.

item.title: Thousands of Black Lives Matter protestors head for London's Hyde Park
item.description: Demonstrators at London's Hyde Park were clad in face masks while standing apart holding signs with messages such as 'Please, I can't breathe', 'BLM' and 'Colour ≠ Crime'.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths in Scotland's care homes now OUTSTRIP hospital fatalities for the first time
item.description: National Records of Scotland (NRS) statistics show there have been 1,818 deaths in care homes when Covid-19 was mentioned on the death certificate, higher than the 1,815 in hospitals.

item.title: 'Suspicious' car 'collides with two pedestrians' in London
item.description: Officers were called to Sloane Square in the west of the capital on Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: President Donald Trump has the highest disapproval rating of any president at this point in office
item.description: President Donald Trump has the highest disapproval rating of any president at this point in office sitting at 54% - the highest it's been since October 2019.

item.title: Priti Patel says 14-day coronavirus quarantine on UK arrivals is 'essential'
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel defied a huge Tory revolt to tell MPs the blanket rule will come into force from Monday, with the next review new due to happen until the end of the month.

item.title: Customers get inventive as McDonald's reopens 497 drive thrus
item.description: McDonald's has announced it is reopening another 497 drive thrus today and a further 43 for delivery as fast food giant aims to have more than 1,000 back in business by the end of the week.

item.title: Simplify 'confusing' array of coronavirus lockdown tests, steps and phases says Blair think tank
item.description: In a report released today the Institute for Global Change says they should be rationalised to allay public fears and allow the economy to safely and strongly restart.

item.title: Google faces $5 BILLION lawsuit in U.S. for 'tracking users in incognito mode'
item.description: Google was sued in San Jose, California, on Tuesday in a proposed class action accusing the internet search company of illegally invading the privacy of people using the 'incognito' mode.

item.title: Boris Johnson reveals plan for proxy voting for MPs shielding from coronavirus
item.description: The Prime Minister made the announcement as his Government faced widespread ridicule over a mile-long 'socially distanced conga' of politicians that snaked around Parliament.

item.title: Emily Ratakjowski, Kristen Stewart, Ben Affleck, Ana De Armas march in Black Lives Matter protests
item.description: Emily Ratajkowski, Kristen Stewart, Ben Affleck and Ana De Armas led the celebrities taking part in Black Lives Matter protests all over the world this week.

item.title: Twitter users are baffled by Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's silence on George Floyd's death
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, now living in Los Angeles, California, stayed offline during Blackout Tuesday on their Sussex Royal Instagram page and did not directly address the protests sweeping the US.

item.title: Breathing is the main source of coronavirus transmission, Chinese scientists say
item.description: Chinese scientists found Covid-19 patients exhale millions of viral particles per hour, even if they have mild or no symptoms. They say it highlights the need for more people to wear face masks.

item.title: Trump demand police to 'get tough' as he privately abandons plan to send in federal troops
item.description: Donald Trump demanded Wednesday that police 'get tough' after a sixth night of nation-wide protests - but privately, the president is backing off his plan to send in federal troops to stifle rioters.

item.title: China blasts 'untrue' report that reveals Beijing was slow to share early coronavirus data
item.description: Zhao Lijian, a spokesman of China's Foreign Ministry, blasted the bombshell report released by Associated Press as 'seriously inconsistent with the facts' during a daily press briefing today.

item.title: Amazon Prime will make all four of its remaining Premier League matches free to air
item.description: It means 33 of the 92 remaining top-flight games this season, shared between Sky Sports, BT Sport, Amazon Prime and the BBC, can now be viewed without a subscription.

item.title: Migrants arrive in Dover as seven more boats cross English Channel
item.description: Up to eight vessels arrived at Samphire Hoe beach near Dover, Kent this morning in what is believed to be the first crossing of the month.

item.title: Saudi teen granted asylum in Canada speaks out on George Floyd and reveals she has a black boyfriend
item.description: Rahaf Mohammed made International headlines last year after she barricaded herself in a hotel room in Thailand to avoid being sent back to Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Keir Starmer attacks Boris Johnson's response
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer today took the gloves off in his battle against Boris Johnson as he battered the Prime Minister over the Government's test and trace programme.

item.title: China slams the UK for 'blindly commenting on our domestic affairs'
item.description: The news comes as Prime Minister Boris Johnson said he would 'willingly' offer three million people from Hong Kong visa-free refuge in the UK if China erodes human rights in the former British colony.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Excess deaths' in England and Wales revealed
item.description: Department of Health bosses have yet to confirm the final tally. The preliminary toll is calculated by adding up the updates provided by each of the home nations.

item.title: Handheld UV light devices that can kill Covid-19 may soon be as common as mobile phones
item.description: Scientists are one step closer to making portable UV light gadgets capable of warding off the coronavirus after Penn State University made a 'breakthrough'.

item.title: Searches for holidays in Spain and Greece increase more than 50 per cent says TravelSupermarket
item.description: TravelSupermarket says there have been 40 per cent more price searches for July, August and September holidays in the last two weeks of May compared with previous fortnight.

item.title: Mother reveals trick for getting fussy three-year-old son to eat vegetables with £6 cake stand
item.description: Toni Bird, from Leicester, took to the Facebook group Extreme Couponing and Bargains to explain how she convinced her three-year-old son to eat healthy foods using a three tier 'treat plate'.

item.title: Heads Together shows support for Black Lives Matter movement
item.description: The Heads Together campaign, which was set up by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and Prince Harry shared an Instagram post supporting the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: Music synchronises the brains of performers with their audience, study claims
item.description: Furthermore, the greater the synchronisation between musician and listeners, the more enjoyable the performance is, researchers from China have concluded.

item.title: Coronavirus Sweden: Epidemiologist admits approach wrong
item.description: Anders Tegnell, Sweden's state epidemiologist, has admitted for the first time that his decision to avoid mandatory lockdown in favour of voluntary social distancing has led to too many deaths.

item.title: Aerial images show how huge Peak District reservoir is a parched trickle after driest ever May
item.description: Sweltering temperatures have dried out Howden Reservoir in Derbyshire from a full basin to just a shallow stream, peeling back the layer of water and exposing the muddy banks below the surface.

item.title: Council probe over Dominic Cummings' family home in Durham
item.description: The Prime Minister's chief advisor Dominic Cummings stayed with his family at the farm in Durham in March when he and his wife Mary Wakefield began suffering coronavirus symptoms.

item.title: British Airways passenger complains about lack of social distancing on 'packed' flight
item.description: A businessman flying from London Heathrow to Gibraltar said it was strange to be on a packed flight before being told to observe social distancing when he'd reached is destination.

item.title: Cash made up just 23% of transactions in 2019 as contactless boomed
item.description: Cash was used for less than a quarter of all payments last year for the first time ever, new figures show, as consumers continue to choose debit cards and contactless payments instead.

item.title: Lea Michele reacts to Glee co-star Samantha Ware's claims
item.description: The actress, 33, vowed to 'be better in the future' and admitted her 'privileged position and immaturity' had contributed to causing pain to her former co-star, 28, in a statement posted on Wednesday.

item.title: SpaceX set to launch another 60 Starlink internet satellites tonight
item.description: SpaceX will launch another 60 of its Starlink internet satellites into space tonight, bringing the total number in orbit around the Earth to 482.

item.title: Five-month-old baby boy returns home after spending 32 days in a coma with coronavirus in Brazil
item.description: Just a few months after his birth Dom Andrade tested positive for COVID-19 at the Pro-Cardiaco hospital in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Google pulls 'Remove China Apps' from the Play Store
item.description: Remove China Apps garnered almost five million downloads in India where anti-Chinese sentiment is growing in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: London boroughs with most lockdown fines
item.description: Metropolitan Police has revealed it issued nearly 1,000 fines during the most stringent weeks of London's coronavirus lockdown. Scotland Yard has revealed the areas where the most fines were issued.

item.title: The three best sunscreens for your skin and how to apply them
item.description: An award-winning dermatologist has recommended three sunscreens for use on your face and body - and how much should be used for it to be effective.

item.title: Tinder fraudster who claimed to be a wealthy surgeon must pay back thousands of pounds to victims
item.description: Amir Tofangsazan, 32, was jailed for seven years and nine months in 2015 after being convicted of 15 counts of fraud. But he got hold of a phone while on day release at HMP Ford, in West Sussex.

item.title: North Korea cracks down on SARCASM (great idea!)
item.description: The phrase was used in a South Korean drama called 'Crash Landing on You' (pictured) and loosely translates to You think you're the general or something?' which is used to mock Kim Jong Un.

item.title: Terrifying moment fearless worker clambers across two power lines to remove fallen branch
item.description: The clip, filmed on Sunday in Telangana, southern India captures a power company worker known as Noor as he slowly makes his way along the high-tension wire.

item.title: Street lamps 'may increase breast cancer risk' by 10%
item.description: A 16-year study in the US compared rates of breast cancer in almost 200,000 women with satellite images of light pollution.

item.title: Touching moment a mother is reunited with her children
item.description: Suzanne Vaughan, from Norfolk, who works as an ODP at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Kings Lynn, was filmed reuniting with her daughters Bella, nine, and Hettie, seven, after nine weeks apart.

item.title: Covid-19 R rate rises to 1.95 in Berlin: Authorities switch 'traffic light' warning systems to red
item.description: Berlin's Health Senator Dilek Kalayci warned there had been a 'turnaround' in the city, just days after he expressed his 'horror' after thousands went out to enjoy the weekend's sunny weather.

item.title: Thousands of peaceful protesters descend on the streets of NYC
item.description: People descended on Foley Square in New York City and also marched on Times Square, taking a knee in the center of the iconic tourist spot.

item.title: Prince Harry will 'understand' his new A-list bodyguard's protocol thanks to his royal upbringing
item.description: Speaking to The Times today, celebrity security expert Will Geddes said Prince Harry will cause few problems for the A-list protection team but that Meghan will have to be aware of boundaries.

item.title: Car makers face an uphill recover post-Covid with April sales in Europe falling 78%
item.description: Markets in Norway, Denmark, Sweden and Finland suffered least, posting declines of 34 to 39% in April as citizens were granted more freedom of movement during the crisis.

item.title: British couples must quarantine before meeting babies after arriving at Ukrainian surrogacy clinic
item.description: Four desperate British couples have flown to Kyiv and are now on a fortnight's quarantine before meeting their infants at the BioTexCom human reproduction centre.

item.title: Celebs face a backlash over 'counterproductive' #BlackoutTuesday
item.description: Rapper Lil Nas X and singer Kehlani were among those to raise doubts about the online trend in which people posted black squares in solidarity with the protests that started in Minneapolis.

item.title: Jealous boyfriend attacks bridesmaid on her sister's wedding night and stamps on her face
item.description: Aaron Williams, 26, stamped on Jessica Gittings' face after she had returned home from her sister's wedding. When her family returned home to find her injured on the floor, Williams fled.

item.title: The future of flight: Blueprint to make flying safe for the Covid era
item.description: Masks, health checks and a limit to on-board movements made up part of the industry guidelines, which also said planes should be regularly disinfected and on-board food be pre-packaged.

item.title: Prince Harry wants to keep his position as ceremonial head of the Royal Marines, ex-soldier claims
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, allegedly wants to keep his position as ceremonial head of the Royal Marines despite quitting as a senior royal, an anonymous ex-soldier has claimed, speaking to The Mirror.

item.title: ALL schools in Wales will reopen on June 29
item.description: Welsh headteachers will only be allowed to have one in three of all pupils on site at any time with year groups attending on different days of the week to maintain social distancing.

item.title: Grieving daughter shares poignant note left by nurses revealing her dying mother was 'not alone'
item.description: A grieving daughter from Reading has shared a poignant message from nurses hidden amongst her mother's belongings after she died. Four nurses signed the note which said her mum was 'not alone'.

item.title: The 11 words most commonly misspelled in Google searches
item.description: The data, commissioned by UK-based firm The Knowledge Academy, is based on Google searches carried out over the last month by users from around the world.

item.title: Dick Wolf fires writer working on his upcoming Law & Order spin-off after controversial post
item.description: Craig Gore threatened to 'light motherf**kers up' going for his property while sharing a photo of himself standing outside on his porch, wielding a gun.

item.title: Rapper appeals conviction for killing Holby City actor's daughter with party drugs
item.description: Ceon Broughton, 31, plied Louella Fletcher-Michie with the hallucinogenic intoxicant 2-CP at Bestival festival, Dorset in September 2017. He appealed his conviction at the Old Bailey today.

item.title: Laurence Fox shares a flippant reference to Blackout Tuesday
item.description: Taking to Twitter as the momentous day got underway, Fox, 42, appeared to make a flippant reference to the lack of movement on social media.

item.title: Boris Johnson condemns 'inexcusable' death of George Floyd
item.description: Boris Johnson added his voice to condemnation as he was asked at PMQs about the wave of furious protests across the US, which have spread around the world.

item.title: University students could live in course 'bubbles' and hold virtual freshers weeks
item.description: Students arriving at university for the first time could be faced with virtual freshers' week events, fewer large-scale lectures and one-way systems across campus to keep them safe from Covid-19.

item.title: Some people are 'emotional eaters' and enjoy the taste of food more when sad
item.description: Researchers found that 'emotional eaters' - those who eat when sad - preferred the taste of food and had a larger appetite when they were feeling negative emotions.

item.title: George Floyd's roommate says he would NEVER use fake cash, take drugs and barely drank alcohol
item.description: George Floyd's roommate of four years Alvin Manago, 55, tells DailyMail.com that Floyd would never use counterfeit money intentionally

item.title: Stone-throwing yobs wanted over death of angler may be as young as 11
item.description: Charles Hilder, 66, was found collapsed in a car park at Lullingstone Castle near Eynsford in Kent last Thursday - and police now want to talk to two boys who were involved.

item.title: NHS coronavirus contact-tracing app could cause 'digital divide'
item.description: The findings from the UK charity Health Foundation raise fresh concerns over the much-anticipated contact tracing solution, which could see some 'left behind'.
item.media:description: The NHS coronavirus contact tracing app (Steve Parsons/PA)

item.title: A Very British Hotel: CEO admits he watched 'cringeworthy' show through his hands
item.description: CEO Rob Paterson, from Australia, who was compared to The Office's David Brent in A Very British Hotel has admitted he watched the 'cringeworthy' show through his hands.

item.title: Cara Delevingne, Machine Gun Kelly and Travis Barker march in Black Lives Matter protests
item.description: The model, 27, carried a cardboard sign that read: 'Silence is consent' as she stood between Kelly, 30, and Travis, 44.

item.title: Almost ALL the countries Britons want to head to have LOWER coronavirus infection rates
item.description: From next week, people coming into the UK from abroad will have to quarantine for 14 days to stop the spread of coronavirus.

item.title: Mother lay dying in garden after Tesco worker husband 'slit her throat'
item.description: Nikoleta Zdun, 18, and her mother Aneta, 40, were found with their throats cut in Salisbury on Monday. Marcin Zdun, 39, appeared via video link before Basingstoke Magistrates' Court today.

item.title: Chinese state newspaper claims the US is a 'failed state' ruled by a 'racist president'
item.description: Global Times slammed President Trump's leadership 'weak, irresponsible and incompetent' and accused American politicians of blaming China for the protests in the US.

item.title: Sophie Ellis-Bextor is rushed to A&E
item.description: The singer was left with nasty cuts and bruises to her head and arms after falling from her bicycle during a bike ride along the Thames on Tuesday evening.

item.title: Two former senior police officers 'sent offensive WhatsApp messages about women they met at work'
item.description: Scott Snowden, pictured, a former Grimsby police inspector appeared before magistrates yesterday to deny the charges. Co-defendant former Superintendent Ed Cook was not at the hearing.

item.title: UK house prices suffer biggest monthly decline in 11 YEARS as lockdown wipes £4,000 off values
item.description: The average cost of a home in Britain last month fell by 1.7 per cent month-on-month, marking the sharpest decline since the depths of the financial crisis in February 2009.

item.title: Some vulnerable pupils 'may NEVER return to school'
item.description: A survey of schools has also found that just a third of headteachers followed the Prime Minister's plan and managed to bring back Reception, Year 1 and Year 6 students back to class on Monday.

item.title: Not only man's best friend!
item.description: In a clip, captured by dog owner Brent Miller, 35, Peyton is seen walking through Westwillow Dog Park in Houston with her brother Parker, as Mr Miller asks her who she sees in the distance.

item.title: Journalist vilified for posed photo in front of boarded-up store in LA amid George Floyd protests
item.description: Video emerged on Monday of a woman borrowing a drill from a construction worker as he erected plywood outside a business in Los Angeles to prevent looters or rioters from breaking in.

item.title: Doctors' union slams Matt Hancock's BAME coronavirus deaths report as a 'missed opportunity'
item.description: The BMA said yesterday's report which showed Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (Bame) Britons were dying at a higher rate than their white counterparts was a 'missed opportunity'.

item.title: WHERE and WHEN tourists can travel in 2020, country by country as the coronavirus lockdown eases
item.description: With major tourist hotspots expected to reopen this month - expectations are again on the rise that summer 2020 may not be limited to just parks and back gardens.

item.title: Amazon driver turns his round into a workout by SPRINTING to a house before doing leg raises
item.description: Footage, captured by homeowner Kate-Gibson Woods, 30, at her property in Virginia Beach, U.S, shows the Amazon courier sprint towards her house and break into an exercise routine.

item.title: How to avoid injury if you've taken up cycling in lockdown
item.description: Victoria Joyce, a former triathlete and clinical tutor in sport physiotherapy and rehabilitation at Liverpool Hope University, shares tips and posture-related hacks or staying injury free with FEMAIL.

item.title: Mexican senator goes TOPLESS during government Zoom meeting after not realising the camera was on
item.description: The 66-year-old Mexican senator Martha Lucia Micher (pictured topless on a zoom call), explained what happened in an open letter she shared online, putting the incident down of her lack of tech-savv.

item.title: Older people risking broadband price hikes over switching fears
item.description: A study by UK broadband provider Zen Internet found many over-55s were risking out-of-contract price rises because they fear switching providers.

item.title: Hapless footballer is knocked over by his OWN penalty
item.description: The 18-year-old striker from Surat Thani, southern Thailand, was dealt a double blow when his missed penalty kick saw the football bounce off the goalpost and knock him to the ground.

item.title: Brazil tops 30,000 coronavirus deaths with a record 1,262 fatalities in the last 24 hours
item.description: Brazil's total number of cases has now reached 555,383, second only to the U.S. Anti-government protests continue to break out in the country (pictured) against its handling of the crisis.

item.title: Golden doodle pup racks up 700K Instagram followers for posing up with baby brother
item.description: Six-month-old Theo, from Connecticut, is best friends with Goldendoodle Samson, and his puppies Charley and Shea, and the foursome have racked up 70,000 followers on Instagram.

item.title: Bank of England 'warns City to brace for Brexit trade talks to FAIL'
item.description: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey (pictured) is said to have warned over the prospects of Brexit trade talks failing in a call with City chiefs this week.

item.title: Crooked solicitor and his colleague tried to sell houses they didn't own in £3m scam
item.description: Hashok Parmar, 63, pictured, and Syed Gous Ali, 46, used the cover of Sterling Law Solicitors, based in Loughborough, in their plan to sell the three London properties.

item.title: Traditional British pubs could be scrapped for Bavarian-style beer halls
item.description: Britain's pubs could be replaced by Bavarian-style bierkellers as they reopen after the coronavirus lockdown. The proposal has been suggested to help pubs comply with social distancing.

item.title: Leah Washington shares a post to mark five years since the crash
item.description: Alton Towers Smiler crash survivor Leah Washington has shared a post to mark five years since she overcame the horrific accident at the amusement park in Staffordshire.

item.title: Pope Francis breaks his silence over George Floyd's death
item.description: After a number of the protests turned violent, with police and protesters clashing in some U.S. cities, the pope said 'Nothing is gained by violence and so much is lost'.

item.title: Portugal hints 'air bridge' with UK could be in place by July
item.description: Britons could soon be able to go on holiday to Portugal without having to quarantine for 14 days when they come back under plans to create 'air bridges' to tourist destinations.

item.title: Haven't they heard of sun-screen? Scorched Britons share snaps of their red skin and dodgy tan lines
item.description: Many Britons will be nursing reddened skin and awkward tan lines after catching a few too many rays over the past few days - with some sharing their sun-screen fails on social media.

item.title: London City Airport will open by June 30 after being closed for 14 weeks
item.description: The airport in the Docklands area of East London announced that domestic routes will be the first to resume, while international flights will restart early next month.
item.media:description: Commercial flights will return to London City Airport by the end of June (Victoria Jones/PA)

item.title: Concern over flaws in data used to rule hydroxychloroquine raises the risk of death for Covid-19
item.description: The Lancet, which published the controversial research on May 22, said there were 'serious questions' to be answered about the data used to come to its conclusions.
item.media:description: Hydroxychloroquine pills are used to treat malaria (John Locher/AP)

item.title: Prince Charles reveals 'frustration' at not being able to open gardens for charity due to COVID-19
item.description: Prince Charles spoke in a video message, filmed at his Scottish home Birkhall, highlighting the work of the National Garden Scheme, which raises funds for health and nursing charities.

item.title: SARAH VINE: I am cured of the urge to join the shopping zombies...
item.description: SARAH VINE: The Swedish furniture giant Ikea re-opened 19 of its UK stores this week and was, to put it mildly, mobbed.

item.title: Italy reopens to tourists as quarantine restrictions are dropped from today
item.description: Italy has dropped all border restrictions for tourists arriving in the country from European Schengen-zone countries and the UK from today, as it tries to salvage its lucrative summer season.

item.title: Nissan warns its Sunderland plant with 7,000 staff will be 'unsustainable' if Brexit talks collapse
item.description: Thousands of workers in Sunderland are facing fresh fears for their jobs after Nissan announced its factory would be 'unsustainable' if the UK fails to strike a Brexit trade deal with the EU.

item.title: Now we know coronavirus is not a random killer, this one-size-fits-all lockdown must come to an end
item.description: Thanks to definitive figures released yesterday by Public Health England, we know that Covid-19 is not a random killer, but one that targets specific groups.

item.title: A QUARTER of headteachers are ready to quit over the stress of trying to run schools
item.description: One in four headteachers are considering quitting because of the 'stressful' coronavirus crisis and demands to get children back, a survey of school leaders revealed today.

item.title: Modern Family star Fred Willard died from a heart attack, death certificate reveals
item.description: The Best In Show actor, who died aged 86 two weeks ago in Los Angeles, suffered a cardiac arrest and had underlying myelodysplastic syndrome and coronary artery disease,

item.title: Shopper smashes car window to free dog that had been sweltering for more than 30 minutes
item.description: Concerned passersby had noticed the pet inside a vehicle in a Tesco car park in Fforestfach, Swansea on Sunday, with the front window cracked slightly open.

item.title: Prince Joachim of Belgium apologises after flying 1050 miles to Spain t
item.description: Prince Joachim of Belgium has apologised for attending a party in Spain last Tuesday, admitting that he 'deeply regrets his actions'.

item.title: Normal People has become the most watched BBC Three show EVER
item.description: The drama, which follows the complex love story of Marianne Sheridan [Daisy Edgar-Jones] and Connell Waldron [Paul Mescal], has won over the hearts of fans.

item.title: Could ibuprofen treat severe cases of Covid-19? Doctors launch trial
item.description: Doctors in London will trial a formula containing ibuprofen to see if it can prevent severe respiratory illness. This could lead to shorter hospital stays and avoid ventilation.

item.title: Some Frankie & Benny's UK restaurants to permanently close after coronavirus lockdown
item.description: A 'large number' of Frankie & Benny's outlets around the UK will remain closed after lockdown, it has been reported, after an email send around to company managers was leaked to the BBC.

item.title: 'Professor Lockdown' Neil Ferguson warns Covid infections are continuing to spill out of care homes
item.description: The Imperial College London scientist - who quit SAGE after being caught flouting stay at home rules - said he was 'shocked' at how badly care homes had been protected during the crisis.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals how to have the hottest 'special occasion' sex
item.description: British sex expert Tracey Cox reveals the seven secrets for having hot 'special occasion' sex. She said how clichés are clichés for a reason and planning requires time and effort.

item.title: How to make a healthy banana bread
item.description: Nutritionist Mays Al-Ali, from London, has revealed the simple steps you can take to make your bake even more nutritionally beneficial, including using gluten free flour and ditching refined sugar.

item.title: Police shame lorry driver found with so much rubbish piled up he couldn't see out the windscreen
item.description: The trucker was pulled over in Hampshire after being found with a shocking haul in his cab, including food, a bucket and sponge and a fly swat.

item.title: Last US citizen receiving a Civil War pension dies in North Carolina
item.description: Irene Triplett, whose father fought for the Union Army between 1863 and 1865, passed away Sunday in Wilkesboro from complications following surgery.

item.title: Justin Trudeau says nothing for 21 SECONDS when asked about Trump using tear gas on protesters
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Tuesday that Canadians are watching what´s unfolding in the United States with 'horror and consternation' and he paused for 21 seconds.

item.title: National Guard troops line up on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial during peaceful demonstration
item.description: Hundreds of people gathered for the demonstration at the Lincoln Memorial Reflecting Pool on Washington DC's fifth consecutive day of protests on Tuesday.

item.title: Tricky 20-question literature quiz will put your knowledge of classic texts to the test
item.description: The 20-question challenge, shared on Playbuzz by quiz veteran Michael Rogers, covers topics including character, setting and plot from British and American novels and plays.

item.title: BBC's smart assistant 'Beeb' will have the accent of a Northern man
item.description: The BBC bosses opted to put a northern twang to the assistant in a conscious move away from the antiquated necessity and prevalence of southern RP (Received Pronunciation) on the airwaves.

item.title: Inside the 13th century Wieliczka Salt Mine in Poland which contains 2,000 rooms and a chapel
item.description: The Wieliczka Salt Mine, near Krakow, was built during the 13th century and is entirely carved in salt. It contains 2,000 rooms, a breath-taking chapel, function chandeliers and a lake.

item.title: Woman creates giant waterproof bed for her garden using old pallets for only £70
item.description: UK-based DIY-enthusiast Tanya Woolston told Facebook's Extreme Coupining and Bargains how she created a giant waterproof bed for her garden, including outdoor lights and cotton curtains.

item.title: Why you should be putting your apples in the fridge as soon as you bring them home
item.description: Australian fruit experts revealed that apples should be kept in the fridge as soon as you bring them home from the supermarket.

item.title: Count the pennies! People reveal the shocking tactics their parents have used to save money
item.description: People from around the world have taken to anonymous sharing app Whisper to candidly reveal the unusual tactics their parents have used to avoid spending money.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the return of sport
item.description: 'Trust you to ALWAYS pick jockeys social distancing themselves from the winner'

item.title: Dr MICHAEL MOSLEY explains why losing weight could be a life-saver
item.description: As we have seen on the news, the Covid-19 virus is very selective about who it kills. Most people, particularly the young, shake it off. But others become extremely ill.

item.title: 9 to 5 actress Peggy Pope passes away in Colorado at the age of 91
item.description: The acting world is in mourning once again, with beloved character actress Peggy Pope passing away at the age of 91.

item.title: World's first plastic free PPE that can be composted in your garden
item.description: The Plastic Free PPE REELshield is priced at 50p an item. It is made from responsibly-sourced paper, the headband, and cellulose extracted from woodpulp, the visor.

item.title: 'Groomer' honeybees remove parasites and build colony immunity
item.description: Workers clean other bees when they are aged between six and 13 days, although some may choose to do it for their whole lives. The behaviour offers possible protection against the varroa mite.

item.title: Older dog unimpressed with hyperactive puppy
item.description: Boston terrier Sophie was still adjusting to her new puppy sibling Cooper in Airway Heights, Washington, when their owner filmed Sophie very unimpressed at Cooper's hyperactive antics.

item.title: Hitler's birthplace to be remodelled and turned into police station
item.description: Austria has unveiled the new design of a police station located inside the house where Hitler was born, with the property to be made 'neutral' so that it doesn't stand out from the rest of the street.
